security: The document includes requests for information on cryptonyms, individuals, and operations, potentially revealing sensitive intelligence methods and sources if disclosed. For example, requesting background information on 'LIRING-3 Mexican Agent With Access to Cuban Target' could expose an active or former asset and compromise ongoing operations.
summary: This document is a series of requests from the Assassination Records Review Board (ARRB) to the CIA's Historical Review Group (HRG) for additional information on various files, crypts, individuals, and operations related to the JFK assassination, followed by a letter updating the status of these requests in October 1996.
summary_one_paragraph: This is a set of documents involving information requests from the Assassination Records Review Board (ARRB) to the Central Intelligence Agency (CIA) regarding JFK assassination-related materials. The requests, dated May 30, 1995, include inquiries about specific file numbers, cryptonyms associated with surveillance operations in Mexico City, background information on individuals linked to CIA activities in 1963-64, and other individuals, operations and symbols. The correspondence also includes a letter dated October 7, 1996, from the ARRB to Barry Harrelson of the CIAâ€™s Historical Review Group, providing an update on the status of the ARRB's formal requests to the CIA, including material relating to Mexico City and CIA staff.
title: ARRB Additional Information Request to CIA
persons_mentioned: Judd Allen Austin (alias Raphael G. Leminger)
recipient: John Pereira, Director, Historical Review Group, CIA
